channel.title: Chinese Chemical Letters
channel.description: A list of the latest news

item.title: Call for Papers: Nanostructured materials for energy and environmental applications
item.description: This Special Issue is focused on “Nanostructured Materials for Energy and Environmental Applications”, featuring the state-of-the-art in this field. Review, Mini-Review, and Communication paper related to the most relevant results regarding nanostructured catalyst formulations and morphologies to be applied in energy and environmental fields are welcome to this Special Issue.

item.title: Call for Papers: Call for Papers: Advanced Materials for High Performance Rechargeable Lithium Batteries and Beyond
News: Connect with Chinese Chemical Letters on WeChat
Highlighted Articles: Quantum chemistry from tree leaves
item.description: Nanoparticles built from leaves could be used to exploit subtle effects of quantum mechanics

item.title: News: Interview with Editor-in-Chief Professor Xuhong Qian
item.description: Since 2007, the Chinese Chemical Society and Elsevier have been working together to publish Chinese Chemical Letters. Read the interview with Editor-in-Chief Xuhong Qian and learn about his impact on the journal and his thoughts on the reasons for the journal’s success.

item.title: News: Five Nobel Laureates Share Inspiration in Scientific Careers at Symposium in Tianjin University
item.description: An scientific feast was celebrated on February 23rd in Tianjin University - five prestigious Nobel Laureates shared their academic achievements at the Peiyang Nobel Symposium, which also marked three joining the other two as Professors of Tianjin University.
